summary: The Healthcare Cybersecurity Act of 2025 aims to enhance cybersecurity in the Healthcare and Public Health Sector. The bill mandates coordination between the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), including the appointment of a liaison. It requires CISA to provide cybersecurity training to healthcare providers and directs HHS to update a sector-specific risk management plan. The bill also allows HHS to identify and notify high-risk covered assets. Finally, it calls for reports on assistance provided to the sector and on federal resources relating to critical infrastructure.
